I’m looking for a freelancer who can teach me GitHub basics step by step. This is not a development project — it’s a hands-on learning role. I already have a .zip backup of my website files (landing page built with HTML/CSS/JS). I need someone to walk me through: Setting up a GitHub repository Uploading my website code Understanding commits, version control, and how to roll back changes How to keep my code organized and secure How to invite other developers without losing control of my code (Optional) How to use GitHub Pages for hosting if needed I am a beginner, so I need someone who is patient, good at explaining in simple terms, and willing to guide me step by step on screen share. What I’m looking for: Strong Git/GitHub experience with active repos Teaching or tutoring ability (clear explanations, no jargon) Good communication in English Available for a few hours of training spread over 1–2 sessions This is a small project, perfect for someone who enjoys teaching. Please include any past experience teaching GitHub or helping beginners.

title: Design Scalable Reverse Proxy & WAF Layer for Multi-Tenant Kubernetes SaaS (1000+ Domains)
rawHtml:
Posted 3 hours ago

Design Scalable Reverse Proxy & WAF Layer for Multi-Tenant Kubernetes SaaS (1000+ Domains)

  • Just not interested
  • Vague Description
  • Unrealistic Expectations
  • Too Many Applicants
  • Job posted too long ago
  • Poor reviews about the client
  • Doesn't Match Skills
  • I am overqualified
  • Budget too low
  • Not in my preferred location
  • The client will not be notified. Your feedback helps us improve job search.
Fixed-price - Intermediate - Est. Budget: $50
We operate a multi-tenant system that hosts client websites (including e-commerce stores) on a Kubernetes cluster in Azure. Each client connects their own custom domain or subdomain to our platform. -- Current Setup Clients point their domain to a paid third-party reverse proxy service (Approximated). Approximated proxies traffic to our Kubernetes cluster while preserving host headers. SSL certificates (Let’s Encrypt) are issued and managed on our Nginx service. Domain Whitelisting is also done at Nginx Ingress. Only minimal DDoS protection is in place. What we want We need a proper Web Application Firewall (WAF) and DDoS protection layer in front of our cluster. (Probably like Azure AGW) Clients should point their domains to this new system, instead of directly to the Approximated IP. -- This system must: Act as a reverse proxy to the cluster, can scale to accommodate 1000s of domains Provide SSL certificate generation/domain name whitelisting in ingress Ensure clean, filtered traffic reaches the cluster -- Tried Already Azure Application Gateway with WAF/AIG — blocked by the 100-domain limit, which makes it unscalable for our SaaS model.
Skills
    Azure DevOps ServerDevOpsNGINX
  Payment verified
